availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert C. Maxey (Monroe County, cabinet maker)

body.p: Monroe County, Kentucky, cabinet maker. Kentucky native. Married to Augustine Maxey. Father of William Maxey, John Maxey, Alfred Maxey, Henry Maxey, and Martha Maxey. Appointed Trustee of the Beech Grove Meeting House and School House in Monroe County in 1843. Farmer in Monroe County in 1850. Cabinet maker in Monroe County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 394A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 61.
Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at the December Session, 1842 (Frankfort, KY: A.G. Hodges State Printer, 1843), 138-39.
